intro: Capsella collina, commonly known as the common mouse-ear or field mouse-ear, is an annual flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many other flowering plants with small, cross-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, featuring hairy stems and lobed leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its small, white or pale yellow flowers appear in clusters and are followed by round, capsule-like fruits containing numerous seeds. Capsella collina is often found in disturbed soils and open fields, where it thrives in sunny conditions.
